item.title: Einstein's bedload diffusion theory
item.description: Hans Albert Einstein was a civil engineer and the son of Albert Einstein, the famous physicist. In his PhD work before 1937, he performed a series of experiments tracking painted sediment through a model river [1]. His was to understand sediment transport in real rivers. Einstein recognized that individual grains within the stream move in an alternating sequence of motion and rest periods, and he attempted to characterize the distance of individual motions and the duration of individual rests.
